intro: Meliosma glauca, commonly known as the blue mist plant, is a member of the Sapindaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. The leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth margin and a glossy surface. It produces small, oval berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate regions of North America.
